intro: Antirhea mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf antirhea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. The fruit is a small capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
